elevator.rmi
Interface Doors

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Subinterfaces:
Elevators
All Known Implementing Classes:
DoorsImpl
public interface Doors
extends java.rmi.Remote

The remote interface for controlling doors of elevators via RMI stub.

The interface is implemented by the proxy class elevator.rmi.impl.DoorsImpl. An object with the DoorsImpl class is created to control doors of elevators.

The elevator.rmi.Doors interface can be used to open or to close all doors, a group of doors or one door. The getDoors() static method of the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class is invoked to get a remote reference to the elevator.rmi.Doors object. For example: 

     MakeAll.init(localhost);
     ...
     Doors doors = MakeAll.getDoors();
     ...
     doors.open(); // open all doors
     doors.close(1); // close the first door
     doors.close({1, 3, 5}); // close doors 1, 3 and 5
     doors.operate({2, 4}, {Doors.OPEN, Doors.CLOSE}); // open door 2 and close door 4
It is worth noting that an object with the elevator.rmi.Doors inteface allows controlling all doors, a group of doors or one door, whereas an object with the elevator.rmi.Door class allows controlling only one door.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
See Also:
MakeAll, Door, Elevator, Elevators

           throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                  IllegalParamException
Close a door of an elevator with a given number.
Parameters:

Throws:
IllegalParamException - if number is not a legal elevator number

operate

public void operate(int[] command)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                    IllegalParamException
Open/close all doors.
Parameters:
command - the array of integer commands (open, close) to all doors. The length of command must be not less than the total number of doors (elevators). A command can be specified either Doors.OPEN or Doors.CLOSE. A command can be also specified as 1 or -1, respectively.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if some element in the number array is not a legal elevator number
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
operate(int[], int[]), OPEN, CLOSE

operate

public void operate(int[] number,
                    int[] command)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                    IllegalParamException
Open/close a group of doors.
Parameters:
command - the array of integer commands (open, close) to all doors. The length of command must be not less than the number of doors specified in array number. A command can be specified either Doors.OPEN or Doors.CLOSE. A command can be also specified as 1 or -1, respectively.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if some element in the number array is not a legal elevator number or/and some element in command is not a legal command, or the length of the command array is less than the length of the number array.
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
operate(int[]), OPEN, CLOSE
